description: Numbers n such that n^2 contains exactly 3 different digits.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
maple: f := []; for i from 0 to 200 do if nops({op(convert(i^2,base,10))})=3 then f := [op(f),i] fi; od; f;
mathematica: t = {}; n = -1; While[Length[t] < 50, n++; If[Length[Union[IntegerDigits[n^2]]] == 3, AppendTo[t, n]]] (* _T. D. Noe_, Apr 26 2013 *)Select[Range[200],Length[Union[IntegerDigits[#^2]]]==3&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 17 2014 *)
author: Asher Auel (asher.auel(AT)reed.edu) Feb 29 2000
